intro: Cypella cultriformis, commonly known as the narrow-leaved cypella, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its slender, sword-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in a compact cluster. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in coastal or inland areas. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
